fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
A number of {{Known issues and troubleshooting}} which exist in a JIRA fresh installation guide (example: new configuration requirement for [Connecting MYSQL to JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/connecting-jira-applications-to-mysql-802592179.html#ConnectingJIRAapplicationstoMySQL-Knownissuesandtroubleshooting]), does not exist in the [upgrade documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Upgrading+JIRA+applications+using+a+rapid+upgrade+method]. This lead to to Admins who are performing an upgrade to missed out this critical information and will stumble issue during an upgrade.

h3. Suggested Solution
To update the upgrade guide and include this known issue/new configuration requirement in the upgrade guide as well.
fields.summary: Missing steps in upgrade documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62116].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the upgrade documentation for [JIRA Software|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Upgrading+JIRA+applications+using+a+rapid+upgrade+method], has the following checklist: {{Check for known issues - Use the [JIRA Knowledge Base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB] to search for any issues in the new version that will affect you.}}
* However,  this will link Admins to the general KB site, where it's rather difficult for the admins to search for the known issue for a particular version of JIRA. As the search result will provide a vast, inaccurate result.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Currently, in our upgrade notes, there is already a section for [known issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-2-x-upgrade-notes-834230197.html#JIRASoftware7.2.xupgradenotes-Informationforadministrators].
* I would suggest that we link Admins to this section instead rather than to the Knowlege Base
* Improve the 'Known Issue' section as well to be up to date to ensure a list of known issue to be retrieved from JAC 
 
h3. Workaround 
* Access the upgrade notes directly
* Raise a support ticket to get updates from Support Engineer
fields.summary: Improvement on upgrading JIRA documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62115].
{panel}
 
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 3 July 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#cccccc|titleBGColor=#dddddd|bgColor=#ffffff}
Thank you everyone for your patience and being so vocal with regards to this feature.

I'm happy to share that on June 29th we've released JIRA 7.4 which contains the HTML Export feature available to all customers. 

As part of this feature, we've also introduced an ability to set limits to the number of exported issues so that you can control the load on your server. You can learn more in latest release notes: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-4-x-release-notes-902079634.html]

Thanks again for your help and feedback!
 Jakub Lazinski
 Product Manager, JIRA Server

 
{panel}
 

*Original request description*

Since exporting to *Excel (HTML)* will be disabled soon, we would like customers to share their feedbacks on the export to *Excel (CSV)*.

Exporting to *Excel (HTML)* will be removed because of:
 - -----JRA-61891-----
fields.summary: Provide your feedback on new CSV export functionality in Jira 7.4

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Special multi-byte characters in file name breaks attachment linking. (e.g. ①, ②）

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach the following image to a JIRA issue
#* テスト.png
#* テスト①.png
# Refer the images as thumbnails in the JIRA issue

h3. Expected Results

The special multi-byte characters like "①" should be handled as normal characters are and both of the thumbnails should be rendered correctly in the issue.

h3. Actual Results

* テスト.png
 !テスト.png|thumbnail! 
* テスト①.png - The thumbnail wasn't rendered correctly as follows
 !テスト①.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Remove the problematic multi-byte character from the filename.
fields.summary: Special  multi-byte characters in file name breaks attachment linking

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

For reporting purposes it would be good if the Two-Dimensional gadget would allow to summarize values, much as an Excel Pivot table enables this possibility.

h3. Suggested Solution

In our scrum team, we use story points to measure the "weight" of issues and I have to make the sums of Story points on different levels:
- How much Story Points are assigned to developer X?
- How much Story Points are open for component Y?
- How much Story Points are scheduled for Release Z?
I can consult values like this in the GreenHopper screens, but this functionality is not usable for reporting purposes,
So, if the two dimensional gadget would allow to make the sum of custom values, it would also be possible to make reports for Story Points.
fields.summary: Make it possible to summarize Story Points, and other custom fields, in Two Dimensional Gadget or other statistics view

h3. Summary

Using JAWS or NVDA, input elements with role="combobox" are described only as:
'combo box collapsed and autocomplete editable blank' for one with nothing pre-selected
or
'combo box collapsed and autocomplete editable selected <Whatever is selected>'

Input elements with role="combobox" have a different id than the previous label for element.

A concrete example is <label for="project"></label>
The actual active element is <input id="project-field"></input> whereas the element labeled as "project" is a hidden input element.

This means that combobox selection elements, such as Project, Issue Type, Priority, Components/s, Reporter, Assignee, Labels, Epic Link, Sprint, and many more are indistinguishable from each other when read aloud:

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any combobox selection elements, such as Project, Issue Type, Priority, Components/s, Reporter, Assignee, Labels, Epic Link and Sprint using JAWS or NVDA

h3. Expected Results
These should be distinguishable from each other when read aloud. 

h3. Actual Results
They're indistinguishable. 

h3. Notes (suggested solutions)
* change the label for id so it matches the id for the actual input element that has role="combobox"
* swap the labels for the the style="display: none;" hidden input element with the element that has role="combobox", so the combobox one gets id "project" and the hidden input element gets the "project-field" id instead.
* Explicitly assign an aria-label attribute for each of the combobox elements, so for the project label, combobox would have aria-label="project".
fields.summary: Accessibility issue for comboboxes

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when Sprint is created in Backlog but not yet started. The issues that are marked as done, are removed from Backlog. When the sprint is started those issues are in the last column which is expected behaviour. 

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer would want to have information of the issues that are completed in the Sprint that is not started yet, similarly like in the case with active sprints. 

In the screenshot below we can see that issues which are completed in the Active Sprint are shown with a strike-through. For Sprint that hasn't started yet, the issues are removed from Backlog. 

 !sprint in backlog.png|thumbnail! 
 

h3. Workaround 

An information about issues that have been completed outside of the Sprint Scope can be seen in the Burndown Chart.
fields.summary: Show done issues in Backlog view for issues which are part of Sprint that haven't started yet

fields.description:
h4. +Summary+
Thanks to JRA-30909, validationQuery is now enabled by default for JIRA Database Connections. However, the value set for PostgreSQL is incorrect.

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
Install JIRA and set up Database Connection using the Setup Wizard.

h4. +Expected behavior+
In JIRA_Home/dbconfig.xml, the value of validationQuery should be _select version();_ (as per [Surviving connection closures|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Surviving+connection+closures]):
{code}
<validation-query>select version();</validation-query>
{code}

h4. +Actual behavior+
In JIRA_Home/dbconfig.xml, the value is _select 1_:
{code}<validation-query>select 1</validation-query>{code}

h4. +Note+
There was a specific case in which Tomcat couldn't shut down in time until validationQuery was set correctly, manually.
fields.summary: validationQuery is incorrectly set for PostgreSQL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user created a Text Field (single line) custom field with long numbers such as "2016290700000780" and export the field to Excel via the Issue Navigator , user will be able to view the  exponential value "2.01629E+15" in the Excel document but they will retrieve the actual decimal value input for that field incorrectly. For example, instead of "2016290700000786" it would be shown as "2016290700000780"


h3. Environment
Tested with 
Jira Server 6.4.5
Jira Server 7.1.4
Jira Server 7.1.8

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Text Field (single line) custom field (for eg: Manual Incident Number).
 !create_custom_field.JPG|thumbnail! 
# Create a issue and add that custom field into that ticket.Enter "2016290700000786" as value of the custom field
 !create_issue.JPG|thumbnail! 
#  Search for that issue in Issue Navigator , make sure you add that column and export all the fields to Excel
 !add_column.JPG|thumbnail! 
# You can view the exponential value is displayed correctly : "2.01629E+15" , but when you click on it or view at the top it display incorrect actual decimal number which showing "2016290700000780" instead of "2016290700000786"
 !exported_excel.JPG|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The decimal value for each exponential value should be equal to what has been input in the Text Field (single line) custom field.
h3. Actual Results
The decimal value for each exponential value is not equal to what has been input in the Text Field (single line) custom field.
fields.summary: Unable to retrieve decimal number from exponential value in a custom field correctly after export Search Results to Excel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Occurs when the permission scheme still had JSD permissions but JSD has been uninstalled.

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Install Jira Core and JSD
 # Create a JSD project
 # Deactivate JSD
 # Edit JSD permission scheme

h3. Expected Result
Permission scheme is editable.

h3. Actual Result
Permission scheme is showing a blank page:
{noformat}
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715437500 2016-07-28 15:01:40,710 http-nio-2992-exec-11 ERROR sysadmin 901x18908x1 1jkiseq 104.192.142.137 /rest/internal/2/managedpermissionscheme/10101 [c.a.p.r.c.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: null
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715439500 java.lang.NullPointerException
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715440500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.buildGrants(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:321)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715440500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.lambda$generatePermissionSchemeBean$4(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:228)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715482500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl$$Lambda$2760/29273610.apply(Unknown Source)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715483500 	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$8.transform(Iterators.java:799)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715483500 	at com.google.common.collect.TransformedIterator.next(TransformedIterator.java:48)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715491500 	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators.addAll(Iterators.java:362)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715491500 	at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:160)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715492500 	at com.google.common.collect.Lists.newArrayList(Lists.java:144)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715501500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.generatePermissionSchemeBean(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:242)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715501500 	at com.atlassian.jira.permission.management.ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.getManagedPermissionScheme(ManagedPermissionSchemeHelperImpl.java:108)
2016-07-28 15:01:40.715502500 	... 2 filtered
{noformat}

h3. Note
 * Not relate to [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/nullpointerexception-on-editing-permission-scheme-826891686.html]
 * Root cause is *Service desk customer - portal access* is still being used
 * *Project Role (Service Desk Team)* and *Project Role (Service Desk Collaborators)* are not affected



h3. Workaround
 # Install JSD > Remove *Service desk customer - portal access* from the permission schemes > Uninstall JSD; *OR*
 # Update the database:
{noformat}
delete from schemepermissions where perm_type = 'sd.customer.portal.only';
{noformat}
fields.summary: Edit Permission Scheme Shows Blank Page

h3. Summary

Road map gadget displays wrong results when the resolution field is not visible.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In field configuration set resolution field to hide
# create a version
# Add a collection of issues to that version, 9 in this example
# Set the status of some of those issues to 'in progress'. 5 in this example
# Marked 2 issues in this example to done.
# Note that the road map gadget now shows 3 of 9 issues resolved instead of 2 of 9 as expected. Click on the version in the road map gadget, note that the version report numbers do not match the count shown on the gadget. The version report is correct the gadget is not.

 !gadget1.png|thumbnail! 
 !2016-07-29_0957.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results
The road map gadget should correctly reflect the number of issues in the done status.

h3. Actual Results
The number on the gadget is incorrectly including issues in 'To do' and 'In progress' statuses.
 
h3. Notes


h3.Workaround
The only work around is to make the resolution field visible on the issue and then change the status of the issue to any status.  The status change updates the gadget.  You can then change the status of the issue immediately back to the original status.
fields.summary: Road Map Gadget is displaying wrong results

h3. Problem definition
Users are able to attach images on transition screens. However when it comes to inserting them in the comments, the attachment icon *does not* appear on the comment panel, which could cause confusion, as shown in the image below:
 !No-attachment-icon.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Include the attachment icon on the comment panel, as shown in the image below. This will allow the user to easily insert images in comments.
 !attchment-icon.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note
* The Attachment button will only appear on a Transition screen when there are existing attachments in the ticket, however, there's no option to browse and upload the attachment by clicking on the "+ Browse" link from the drop-down of the Attachment button. Hence, the workaround is to add the system Attachments field to the transition screen. 
* To upload an attachment during a transition, click on the "browse" link on the Attachments field to upload a file or use the drag and drop functionality. When the file is uploaded and present on the Transition screen, the Attachment button will be visible and user can choose to embed the file by clicking on the Attachment button and select the file.
fields.summary: Include the attachment icon on the attachment transition screen to make it more intuitive

fields.description:
*******{*}This Bug was recently observed in Jira Server 8.5.4 version{*}******
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for {*}JIRA Server{*}. Using {*}JIRA Cloud{*}? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62072].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Scheduled Jobs can be lost track when a database operation fails at the moment the job is claimed by the Scheduler.

 
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Server (Single Node - Non Data Center)
 * JIRA Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Schedule a Job.
 # Introduce a breakpoint at {{CaesiumSchedulerService.executeClusteredJob}}
 # Interrupt database connectivity.

h3. Actual Results
 # JIRA will lose track of the job until a restart is performed.

h3. Expected Results.
 # JIRA will run the job under its schedule as soon database connectivity is resumed

h3. Notes

This is the root caused behind the issue reported at JSD-3653 but could affect any scheduled job in JIRA.
h3. Workaround

Restart JIRA.
fields.summary: Database connectivity issue causes scheduled jobs to break

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In a JIRA Data Center Environment, ClassNotFoundException can be seen in the logs due to an installed plugin thread initializing JIRA Data Center cache with its own classloader.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Data Center
 * Reproduced with JIRA Data Center 7.1.x with Structure Plugin 3.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a JIRA Data Center with at least 2 nodes.
 # Find / build a plug-in which starts a thread in a constructor / plugin event / module event listener.
 # That thread inside of the 3rd party plug-in / custom made plugin should be the first who initialises the cache. For example the thread can call com.atlassian.jira.user.ApplicationUsers.byKey to cause cache initialisation.
 # !/images/icons/emoticons/warning.png!  NOT FOR PRODUCTION USE. You can use the attached jira-cache-accessor-plugin.jar as a demo how to init the cache with the wrong classloader.
 # Observe the logs during JIRA startup. Alternative - see the logs on cache synchronization.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA webapp classloader is used to initialize and access the cache, and there are no errors with replicating the cache to other nodes
h3. Actual Results
 # Cache is initialized with the plugin's class loader, rather than the correct class loader for the code. 
 (i) In the sample plug-in we can see that  see now which class loader used to init the EagerOfBizUserCache. I.e. *initialized with class loader: BundleDelegatingClassLoader.* To see that I've modified EagerOfBizUserCache to log which class loader is used to initialize the cache.
 # Errors similar to the following are thrown in the application logs during cache replication to other nodes. Note that this errors will be show at "healthy node" and actual problem is at other node(s).
{code:java}
2016-05-26 12:03:12,218 http-nio-8080-exec-8 ERROR anonymous 723x169744x1 1fhqh5i 10.223.41.99,10.233.128.11 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [n.s.ehcache.distribution.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator] Exception on replication of removeNotification. RemoteException occurred in server thread; nested exception is: 
    java.rmi.UnmarshalException: error unmarshalling arguments; nested exception is: 
    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.DirectoryEntityKey not found by com.almworks.jira.structure [18] (no security manager: RMI class loader disabled). Continuing...
java.rmi.ServerException: RemoteException occurred in server thread; nested exception is: 
java.rmi.UnmarshalException: error unmarshalling arguments; nested exception is: 
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.atlassian.jira.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.DirectoryEntityKey not found by com.almworks.jira.structure [18] (no security manager: RMI class loader disabled)
at sun.rmi.server.UnicastServerRef.dispatch(UnicastServerRef.java:354)
{code}
or
{code:java}
2016-08-01 16:44:50,516 Caesium-1-4 ERROR      [n.s.ehcache.distribution.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator] Exception on replication of putNotification. RemoteException occurred in server thread; nested exception is: 
    	java.rmi.UnmarshalException: error unmarshalling arguments; nested exception is: 
    	java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: net.sf.ehcache.Element not found by com.almworks.jira.structure [17] (no security manager: RMI class loader disabled). Continuing...
java.rmi.ServerException: RemoteException occurred in server thread; nested exception is: 
	java.rmi.UnmarshalException: error unmarshalling arguments; nested exception is: 
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: net.sf.ehcache.Element not found by com.almworks.jira.structure [17] (no security manager: RMI class loader disabled)
	at sun.rmi.server.LoaderHandler.loadClass(LoaderHandler.java:396)
{code}

h3. Workaround (for plugin developers)
 * Plugin developers may consider wrapping such calls with a class loader switching code, to ensure that the right class loader is used. For example, in a case of calling ApplicationUser's static methods, the class loader switch may be as easy as:
{code:java}
ClassLoader previous = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
try {
   Thread.currentThread().setContextClassLoader(ApplicationUsers.class.getClassLoader());
   ApplicationUsers.getKey() 
} finally {
   Thread.currentThread().setContextClassLoader(previous);
}
{code}

h3. Workaround (for users)
 # Disable the plugin that triggered the cache problem: Structure or other
 # Restart node(s) not having mentioned error
 # Enable plugin again

h3. Alternative Workaround (for users)

If the workaround above does not work on your case, try the following:
 # Disable the plugin triggering the cache problem (Structure, ScriptRunner or other).
 # Remove *node1* from the load balancer and restart JIRA on that node.
 # When *node1* is back up, re-add it to the load balancer and restart *node2*.
 # Repeat steps 2-3 for the other nodes.
 # After all nodes have been restarted, enable the plugin causing the issue again.

h5. Structure

Almworks has released new version *3.3.0.jira7* which has the fix.
fields.summary: Installed plugins initializing Data Center cache with wrong class loader

h3. Problem Definition

Currently after each fresh installation of JIRA, it is required to manually perform the copying of Connector/J JDBC driver to the <JIRA installation directory>/lib/ directory.
h3. Suggested Solution

To provide a download option with user agreement and acknowledgement tick box during the installation of JIRA.
h3. Workaround
 # Get the MySQL driver:
 ** If you are installing JIRA, download the recommended MySQL driver JDBC Connector/J 5.1.
 You can download either the .tar.gz or the .zip file by selecting the 'Platform Independent' option. Extract the jar for the driver (e.g. mysql-connector-java-5.x.x-bin.jar) from the archive.
 ** If you are upgrading JIRA and you are not using the recommended MySQL driver (JDBC Connector/J 5.1), back up the driver from your JIRA installation before you upgrade.
 The driver will be in the <JIRA installation directory>/lib/ directory.
 # Copy the MySQL JDBC driver jar to the <JIRA installation directory>/lib/ directory for your new/upgraded installation. If you are installing JIRA using the Windows installer, you will need to do this step after running the Windows installer, but before running the setup wizard.
 # Restart JIRA / JIRA service.
fields.summary: Include Database JDBC Drivers into JIRA for MySQL

h3. Summary:
 * When installing a new Language Pack and set it as JIRA Default Language, the next time when the language pack is uninstalled, the language stays and did not actually changed to any other available language pack.


h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Access the link below to get any additional language pack:
 -- [https://translations.atlassian.com/]
 # Download any language pack.
 # Access JIRA and navigate to _JIRA Administration > Add-ons > Manage Add-ons_
 # Click "Upload Add-on" and select the recently downloaded language pack. Wait until it finish installing.
 # Navigate to _JIRA Administration > System > General Configuraiton_ and click Edit settings.
 # Confirm that the new language pack is listed in the "Installed Language" and select the "Default Language" to it.
 # Navigate back to the "Manage Add-ons" page and uninstall the new language pack.
 # Return back to the "General Configuration" page and check the "Default Language"


h3. Expected Result:
 * The Default Language will auto adjust to another language as the current selected language before has been uninstalled.


h3. Actual Result:
 * The Default Langauge stay as it is even though the language has been uninstalled.

h3. Workaround:
* Restart JIRA.
* Navigate back to JIRA General Configuration and change the language manually, the uninstalled language would not selectable anymore.
fields.summary: JIRA Default Language Persist even though the Language Pack has been uninstalled

fields.description:
h3. Summary

"Invite User" function should send email out as the address set in "Outgoing Mail", instead of using the current logged in user's email address as the "From" address. Some SMTP servers will reject emails because of this.
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.1.x
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as any admin user and send out invites by using "Invite User" function.

h3. Expected Results

Invite email should be sent out
h3. Actual Results

The invite email will not be sent, SMTP server returns errors such as "553 Mail from must equal authorized user" or "554 Message Rejected" depending on what SMTP server is used. This is because the "From" address header does not match the user address set in JIRA's "Outgoing Mail".

However, this problem does not apply to all SMTP servers, GMail for example, automatically strips & replace the "From" address, and still send out the email. As shown in the example email header below, the original "From" address header is stripped and moved to "X-Google-Original-From".
{code:java}
Return-Path: <smtpserver@gmail.com>
Received: from apackl ([111.11.11.111])
        by smtp.gmail.com with ESMTPSA id r21sm12370338pfi.52.2016.07.27.20.29.03
        for <user@gmail.com>
        (version=TLS1_2 cipher=ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 bits=128/128);
        Wed, 27 Jul 2016 20:29:04 -0700 (PDT)
From: "admin (JIRA)" <smtpserver@gmail.com>
X-Google-Original-From: "admin (JIRA)" <admin@example.com>
Date: Thu, 28 Jul 2016 11:29:01 +0800 (MYT)
Reply-To: admin@example.com
To: user@gmail.com{code}
To avoid this problem, the "Invite User" function should really use the address set in the outgoing mail server settings as the "From" address (which would be the same as how JIRA notifications are being sent out), instead of using the current logged in user's email.

h3. Workaround

The KB article [550 5.7.1 Unable to Relay Mail From Exchange Server - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/550-5-7-1-unable-to-relay-mail-from-exchange-server-143884327.html] explains that it might be possible to change the configuration of your mail server to then allow for the relaying of messages
fields.summary: "Invite User" function sending out email as the current logged in user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62056].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When entering time worked, it would be helpful if the time started, could be input so that the amount of time entered reflects when time was actually worked on an issue.


h3. Environment
Cloud / Server



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Click More
# Add work
# Enter time worked


h3. Expected Results
Time worked screen should allow a user to enter the time the work was actually started


h3. Actual Results
JIRA assumes that work is starting at that given time and there is no way to tell JIRA work started hours/minutes earlier

 
h3. Notes
This would extremely helpful if a developer performed work and then at the end of the day went through and entered their worked time. While JIRA will subtract their time from remaining hours, etc., it enters the time worked as starting at that very moment.


h3.Workaround
Currently time should be entered when it is actually starting.
fields.summary: Allow users to change when time worked was actually handled

fields.description:
We found out that sometimes BTF exports contain inconsistent user data, namely some crowd users (cwd_user table) do not have corresponding app users (app_user table) even though export comes from JIRA BTF 7.1. 

All crowd users without corresponding app users were not active, but it does not explain why app users were missing as they always should be created. 

This data inconsistency started to cause import failures in the Cloud after we made some changes in Cloud code (previously we did not care about app_users during import). 

We added some code to fix the data during the Cloud import, but the cause of data inconsistency in export file should also be investigated.
fields.summary: Inconsistent user data in BTF exports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62038].
  {panel}

h3. Description

When customer import a CSV file with a em dash (–) in the content, JIRA will treat it as invalid characters and import it as *?* into the system. Em dash (–) is an utf8 character and is a longer dash symbol than the normal dash ( - ). However, JIRA CSV importer treat it as a non utf8 character when importing the issue content. For details, please refer to this [documentation|http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/2014/index.htm].
 

h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Create a CSV file which contains em dash (–) in description or summary field and save it.
 # Login JIRA and use CSV importer to import the CSV file
 # Ignore the warning message show during the import
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
 # Check the issue after successfully imported the issue

 

h3. Expected result

!image-2016-07-26-21-57-53-941.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. 
h3. Actual result

!image-2016-07-26-21-57-17-439.png|thumbnail!


h3. Workaround
Replace all the em dash (–) to normal dash ( - ) in the CSV file and import
fields.summary: CSV import em dash (–) as invalid characters �

h3. Problem Definition
Currently , in order for the user to be added to Watcher list , they need to have *Browse Project* permission. By having the permission , they are allowed to view the entire project issue . The workaround is to configure the *Issue Security* to control the issue access . However , it still not recommended because admin needs to configure multiple levels .

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admin to add the user as watcher without having *Browse Project* permission . The watcher only allows viewing the ticket that he/she been added to .
fields.summary: Allow watcher only can view the ticket he/she been added to .

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62036].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Two dimensional filter statistics doesn't show the hyperlink for issues that are on Select List ( single choice ) of option "None" when the field is hidden
 !unselectable.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field of type Select List ( single choice )
 Eg: "Severity" with options "one", "two", "three"
 # On a sample project, assign random issues values for this field
 # Go to the dashboard and add Two dimensional filter statistics gadget.
 # On xaxis = Newly created custom field Eg: Severity
 # On yaxis = Issue Type
 # Now you should see the gadget and any issues that do not have a value for field "severity" will come under column *None*. These numbers under this column will have a hyperlink
 # Now go to the projects Field configuration and set the "severity" field to *hidden*
 # Come back to the gadget on the dashboard

h3. Expected Results
You should still be able to get the hyperlink for issue that do not have a value for "severity" field

h3. Actual Results
* The column "None" has now changed name to "Irrelevant" and the issues under them do not have a hyperlink as shown in the above screenshot. 
* Update: In JIRA 7.5 the new bug was introduced (JRASERVER-66318) causing confusion due to the filter giving back a quantity of issues different than the count of issues considered in the gadget and this in turn make the numbers not matching at all, like in this example:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
It is important to note that those are two distinct issues. Please refer to JRASERVER-66318 if you are experiencing a missing "None" column.

h3. Workaround
* None
fields.summary: Two dimensional filter statistics doesn't show the hyperlink for issues that are on Select List ( single choice ) of option "None" when the field is hidden

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62035].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Sometimes when a user tries to view their dashboards, the dashboard is empty without any configured gadgets displayed.


h3. Environment
* Happens more frequently in *Chrome* and *IE 11*


h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a *long list of dashboards* with couple of gadgets on each dashboard.
# Go to the Dashboard page, click on one of the dashboards from the list on the left panel.
# *Scroll on the mouse* while the dashboard is loading.


h3. Expected result
The selected dashboard and its gadgets will load properly.


h3. Actual result
* The selected dashboard is empty without any gadgets loaded, only the dashboard title and 3 functionality buttons (Add Gadget, Edit Layout, Tools) are displayed.
* Error {{Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'left' of null}} is observed in the Browser Console


h3. Notes
* Clearing browser cache helps to bring back the dashboard with all gadgets temporarily
fields.summary: Dashboard fails to load with error "Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'left' of null" appears in the browser console
ApplicationUsers' static methods will call components from pico with incorrect class loader if called from plugin

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user tried to open an issue which has a User Picker (multiple users) Custom Field in the browser (via New Window), the total number of remaining users for that field is not rendered correctly. This happens only when the window is not maximised. 

h3. Environment
* IE11
* Chrome 42
* Chrome 51

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any browser in a new window with small size resolution
# Paste the link of any Jira issue with User Picker (multiple users) Custom Field
# You can see the total number of remaining users in that field is not rendered correctly as below:
 !before.JPG|thumbnail! 
# But when you Maximize the browser size, then you should be able to view the total number of remaining users in that field as below:
 !after.JPG|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Able to view the total number of remaining users in the User Picker (multiple users) Custom Field when opened in a new Window with smaller browser size 

h3. Actual Results
Able to view the total number of remaining users in the User Picker (multiple users) Custom Field when opened in a new Window only in a maximized browser size
fields.summary: List of user in User Picker (multiple users) Custom Field rendered incorrectly when open the issue in a browser (via new Window)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62030].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When navigating through the Release notes documentation you are presented with links to look at the new features, however these take you to the latest version of JIRA and not the one you are looking at the notes for.

For example: The release notes for JIRA 6.4: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/jira-6-4-release-notes-678561444.html link to new features, like integrating with HipChat.  The link https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/configuring-jira-with-hipchat-296093745.html is redirected to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Integrating+with+collaboration+tools which is the JIRA Software 7.1 documentation when it should be going here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/configuring-jira-with-hipchat-720412710.html

h3. Suggested Solution
Change these links to match the versions of the release notes that they are related to.
fields.summary: JIRA Release notes documentation links take you to the wrong versions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
High memory usage in Firefox after page refresh. Problem is specifically bad for JIRA reindex page is it refreshes pages very frequently. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA
* Firefox 47.0.1 at OSX 10.11.5 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to JIRA re-index page.
# Wait until process finished.
# Check memory usage
* about::memory - https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Performance/about%3Amemory
* [Memory_profiling|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Performance#Memory_profiling_and_leak_detection_tools]

h3. Expected Results
Memory usage is low.

h3. Actual Results
Memory usage is high. It grows from 50MB to 150MB in my case. In a worth case it can be 1GB. 
Memory usage:
 !PS_FF_active_reindex_mem.png|thumbnail! 
Memery snapshot of DevTools - usage grows:
 !PS_FF_active_reindex_snap.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* Problem is not reproduceable in Chrome
* Problem happens with other JIRA pages in Firefox
* Problem happens with other non-JIRA pages (less likely) in Firefox
* May be related to https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1141242

h3.Workaround
* Close tab and restart the Firefox
* Use other browser
fields.summary: High memory consumption in Firefox after page refresh

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62023].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Issue that is being updated (adding comment) via email is creating a {{text.html}} attachment to the issue (and an Issue Updated event).

h3. Environment
* MAC Outlook Client
* Exchange Server for incoming and outgoing mails.
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket in JIRA, doesn't matter using UI or email.
# Update the ticket via email.
# Observe that there will be {{text.html}} attachment.

h3. Expected Results
The issue is being commented without {{text.html}} attachment

h3. Actual Results
The issue is being commented with {{text.html}} attachment
The content of the email header file:
{noformat}
Attachment: text.html
 <http://<base-url>:8080/browse/IT-1#add-comment> Add Comment
<http://<base-url>:8080/browse/IT-1#add-comment>
  
This message was sent by Atlassian JIRA (v6.4.8#64023-sha1:bab6790)



--B_3523450212_10300204
Content-type: text/html;
	charset="US-ASCII"
Content-transfer-encoding: quoted-printable

<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.0 Strict//EN" "http://www.w3.org=
/TR/xhtml1/DTD/xhtml1-strict.dtd">
<html xmlns=3D"http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<meta http-equiv=3D"Content-Type" content=3D"text/html; charset=3Dutf-8">
<meta name=3D"viewport" content=3D"width=3Ddevice-width, initial-scale=3D1.0, maxim=
...
{noformat}
This seems like its all coming from the mail client.

h3.Workaround
* Send email from MAC Outlook Client on plain TEXT format.
* Send email from MAC Outlook Client on plain HTML format with the option 'Preferred encoding for new messages' unchecked in Outlook Composing Configuration.
fields.summary: Updating issue via email using Exchange Server creating text.html attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62015].
  {panel}

*Current Behaviour*
Release version and view is associated with only one project.

*Example Scenario*
We are using JIRA to support multiple customers that are using our same product, some of those customers are using the same product version, and therefore are tied to a release cycle for that product version. Under the current implementation I am mapping customer issues to our product release on a JIRA project by project basis. This is fine for a customer-facing view. But there are scenarios where I have implemented a couple JIRA projects for 1 customer to accommodate their workflow. In this 2nd scenario looking at a release on a JIRA project by project basis fails.

*Requested Behaviour*
Allow to view multiple release version under one release view page. We can have this in board's release menu. Customer could define a product version, and under that have various releases versions. Then in any of the JIRA projects they would just tie the project to that product version(s), and thereafter be able to select fix version(s) from the list of releases that exist under that product version.
fields.summary: Release view that span multiple JIRA projects

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62012].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When CROWD is connected to JIRA for user management, the users that are pulled does not have a detail of where the uses belongs to and which user directory except that it shows that the user belongs to CROWD server.
 !Capture 2016-07-06 at 13.24.48.png|thumbnail! 

We need to log in to CROWD server every time we need to check which LDAP server or where the users is actually linked to.
 !Capture 2016-07-06 at 13.26.05.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

There is no suggested solution.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62009].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently in JIRA, user is allowed to choose to add specific days from the "Non Working Days". But this will affect all users and not specific users' "Working day" configuration.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add feature to the "Working Days" to exclude user specific vacation days. For more detailed example, please refer here:

{quote}We'd like a way of adding individuals' holiday schedules and exclude these from the working time available calculation, such as when assigning tasks to a Sprint.
For example, 4 weeks with 37.5 hours = 150 hours per person, but with a 2-week vacation in the middle is only leaves 75 working hours for that person.{quote}

h3. Workaround 

No workaround available.
fields.summary: Agile planning taking planned vacations into account

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62008].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

I would like to have a report or gadget to show the burndown graph by the total # of subtasks completed vs not completed for a particular sprint. So, for example, if I have a total of 40 subtasks for 10 stories that are included in Sprint 25, I would like to have the burndown graph or report for the total # of subtasks that are completed vs not completed for a specific sprint. So for sprint 25 week 1 (or whenever I run this report or gadget), it will show me the burndown graph completed vs not completed for a specific sprint at that time.

h3. Suggested Solution
None

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Burndown graph by the total # of subtasks completed vs not completed for a particular sprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62007].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Pie Chart Gadgets do not display correct results when the selected statistic type is a custom field configured for more than one context with the same custom field values
h3. Environment
 * JIRA version 6.4.3
 * JIRA version 7.1.9
 * Jira version 8.13.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Custom field(tested with check box type) and associate it to a project.
 # Create a new context in the same custom field with the same values and associate it to a different project as shown in below image  !customfieldcontex.png!
 # Create some issues by selecting values for the custom field.
 # Create a filter for this which includes both the project which is using this custom field
 # Add this filter to Pie Chart Gadget, and set this custom field as the statistics type

h3. Expected Results

The pie chart displays one row per custom field option.
h3. Actual Results

The pie chart displays multiple rows per custom field option as shown in the screenshot below  !Pie Chart.png!
h3. Workaround

Create separate filter for each Project which uses custom field with context and associate them in different Pie Chart
----
fields.summary: Pie Chart Gadgets do not display correct results for a custom field with more than one context with the same values

Closing all stories should trigger automatic closing of parent epic in Simplified workflows
Is there a way to automatically add a issue in two projects at a time in JIRA. For example: If i create a issue in "Sample-A" project that same issue will automatically create in "Sample-B" project.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62001].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The left Filter panel on *search for issues* screen offers a dock/undock functionality, by clicking the arrows, as shown in the image below:
 !dock-undock-filter.png|thumbnail! 


To *undock* the panel, the user can click on the right angled arrows "*>>*" or hover over it. If the user hovers over it, the panel expands *temporarily* until the user moves away. 

This causes some confusions and is not user friendly to the end user. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the users with the ability to choose their preferences, *either* just by clicking the arrows, or just by hovering on it, but not both.
fields.summary: Dock/undock of the filter panel should be more user friendly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61999].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Currently JIRA does not allow a user to create an additional 'Attachment' type field. In the case where a customer wants to include this field in an 'Issue Collector' as a 'Required' field, the customer cannot as placing this requirement on the existing 'Attachment' field would alter this fields behavior for the entire JIRA instance.


h3. Environment
Cloud
Server


h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Goto: Administration > Issues > Custom Fields

or 

- Type G+G 
- Type in 'Custom Fields'
- Press 'Enter'


h3. Expected Results
When clicking the 'Add custom field' button, a user should be able to search for 'Attachment'
The user should be able to apply the same type of attributes to this field as they would with the already existing 'Attachment' field: Required, etc.


h3. Actual Results
When clicking the 'Add custom field' button and searching for 'Attachment' there are no results found as we currently do not allow for a custom field of the type 'Attachment' to be created

 
h3. Notes
In the case of requiring an attachment field within an 'Issue Collector' form, this is not possible as we do not outright expose the code for the 'Issue Collector'. This means that validating the 'Attachment' field is not possible as there is no way to attach the 'onClick' event to the form submission button
fields.summary: Allow custom attachment fields to be created for use within JIRA and Issue Collectors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61997].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Request the ability to use text instead of images to be shown on the *Priority* field of JIRA Issues.
When using the issue navigator, user informed that the default priority images can be confusing and was wondering if he could change them to keywords (like Critical, High, medium, low).

See on the screenshot below how the priority field is currently displayed on issue navigator:
 !image-2016-07-21-15-03-08-135.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to choose keywords instead of images on Issues Priority field and make these keywords to be shown on Issue navigator.
fields.summary: Ability to choose between text or image to display in JIRA Issue Priority

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61996].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Finding out the current access that a user has is an important security feature in user management


h3. Suggested Solution 
An overview of all projects to which a user has access (with possible drill-down to determine the exact access rights for that project), would help immensely, and make the overall security process easier to control.


h3. Workaround
Use the permission helper but you have to choose an issue per project and you can check one project at the time, having many projects this can take quite some time.
fields.summary: It should be possible to see which projects a user has access to in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61994].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If user has FullName with comma you can't search for that name. JIRA assumes that comma (,) is part of the name. Some for dashes or similar. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow to configure how Full Name should be tokenized and improve search based on this.

h3. Workaround 
(Optional)
fields.summary: As an JIRA Administrator I want to be able configure tokenizer for user Full name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-61993].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

User picker does not ignore commas when attempting to search for a user's full name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add several users with the following convention for their full name <last name, first name>. For example:
 * John, Dow
 * Martin, Smith

 # Search for user in User picker fields

h3. Expected Results

You can search for user First-name and it will return result

h3. Actual Results

You can't search for user First-name. 
 Assume name is: Martin, Smith
 * Martin Smith - returns nothings
 * Martin - may return value, but list can be huge
 * Smith - may return value, but list can be huge
 * Martin, Smith - can't be entered as User picker uses comma as separator.

See example:
 !JRA_61993_user.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This is applicable to watches field, when it enabled at edit screen (see [Add watchers in the Issue creation screen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Add+watchers+in+the+Issue+creation+screen])
See related improvement ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-61994

h3. Workaround

Use username or email to search user.
fields.summary: User picker does not ignore commas when attempting to search for a user's full name
